Famous Feuds
programme.desc: Disney princesses Demi Lovato and Selena Gomez find out that fame and friendship don't mix, and reality stars Holly Madison and Kendra Wilkinson become vicious rivals.

programme.title: Cheaters
programme.desc: Donna's behaviour changes after speaking about marriage, causing Willie to call in the investigators. Hidden cameras reveal the truth.

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: This new series goes behind closed doors to find out what really happens between neighbours when disputes arise.

programme.title: Housebound Trapped Inside
programme.desc: Hosted by forensic psychiatrist Dr. Keith Ablow we learn how agoraphobia sufferers deal with the disorder on a daily basis and if they can overcome it and learn to live a normal life.

programme.title: Auction Kings
programme.desc: An exact replica of the Back to the Future DeLorean Time Machine has the potential to be the biggest sale in Gallery 63's history.

programme.title: Auction Kings
programme.desc: The U.S. Space and Rocket Center auctions off a Vintage Race-car, an Apollo 13 Pinball Machine owned by actor Bill Paxton and 2 rare Soviet Spacesuits that have actually been in space!

programme.title: Close Calls On Camera
programme.desc: Series presented by Nick Knowles which shows the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale.

programme.title: Cheaters
programme.desc: Kristopher suspects Stephanie of cheating, so he calls the investigators to help. Their investigation soon leads them to discover that Stephanie is spending time with another man.

programme.title: High Alert
programme.desc: From street patrols to busting notorious criminals, the Eblen brothers are an unstoppable force at the helm of family business NightGuard.

programme.title: Operation Repo
programme.desc: From luxury boats and sports cars to trucks, if you can't make your payments, the team will find you! When it comes to recovering property, Lou, Sonia, Matt, Froy and Lyndah will stop at nothing.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: An alleged assault of a pregnant woman, an arrest, and private pictures of an ex-lover come into play when a relationship ends.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Teen ex-lovers fight over custody of a Golden Labrador named Munch Munch; allegations of animal abuse are disputed.

programme.desc: Mark Hobson killed four people in North Yorkshire, England in July 2004. Police discovered notes he had written that showed the murders were pre-meditated.

programme.desc: This documentary explores and highlights the different elements of domestic abuse, including coercion and stalking, that so often lead to serious violence or homicide.

programme.desc: Programa que ofrece a los espectadores la oportunidad de aprender inglés de la mano del profesor Richard Vaughan. El espacio pretende introducir al público de lleno en el idioma, tanto desde el punto de vista gramatical como desde el analítico.

programme.title: LaLiga
programme.desc: En una pelea de todos contra todos, solo los más fuertes se mantienen, alcanzan Europa, se meten en Champions o alzan el título. Así es LaLiga, el campeonato de la regularidad con los veinte clubes más potentes del fútbol español. El Barcelona defiende la corona.(c)

programme.title: Champions League 16/17
programme.desc: La Champions League es, sin duda, el torneo de clubes más deseado. El Real Madrid es el campeón actual y tiene el reto de repetir título. Barcelona, Atlético y Sevilla aspiran a levantar la copa, en un pelotón que incluye a Bayern, Manchester City, Juventus o PSG.(c)

programme.title: La Liga 03/04: Real Madrid-Atlético de Madrid
programme.desc: La 14ª jornada de Liga tiene como plato fuerte el derbi madrileño entre Real y Atlético. Carlos Queiroz ha recuperado a todas sus estrellas y podrá alinear a su once de gala. Los rojiblancos ocupan puestos de Champions y desean el triunfo en el feudo de su máximo rival.(c)

programme.title: Conecta Informativo
programme.desc: Un profundo repaso a la actualidad que ha generado el Real Madrid en las últimas horas, tanto a nivel institucional, como en los equipos de fútbol, de baloncesto y de la cantera. En el informativo también se escucharán a los protagonistas de las noticias.

programme.title: Hoy jugamos
programme.desc: Real Madrid TV hace un seguimiento especial del equipo blanco. El programa describe los momentos previos y posteriores al partido a través de entrevistas y reportajes.

programme.title: Proyecto Dinosaurio
programme.desc: En 2011, la Sociedad Criptológica de Inglaterra envió una expedición al Congo en busca del equivalente africano al monstruo del Lago Ness. Los investigadores desaparecieron pero se hallaron algunos vídeos que podrían probar la existencia de especies que hacia 65 millones de años se creían extinguidas. Sid Bennett, el director del aclamado documental para televisión "Sirenas: el descubrimiento", dirige su primer filme que recuerda a películas como.(c)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: La Champions League es la competición de clubes más importante de Europa. El Real Madrid es el campeón actual, al ganar en la última final al Bayer Leverkusen.(c)

programme.title: 15 minutos
programme.desc: Un resumen extenso de los partidos del Real Madrid en todas las competiciones en las que participa. El club blanco suscita mucho interés allá por donde va y sus partidos son analizados con lupa por los críticos de este deporte.(c)

programme.title: La Liga 14/15
programme.desc: El fútbol español puede presumir de su Liga, una competición con una nómina de estrellas impresionante. El Atlético sueña con repetir título, aunque lo tendrá complicado ante los reforzados Barcelona y Real Madrid. El resto de equipos pelean por objetivos más mundanos.(c)

programme.title: Conecta Informativo
programme.desc: Un profundo repaso a la actualidad que ha generado el Real Madrid en las últimas horas, tanto a nivel institucional, como en los equipos de fútbol, de baloncesto y de la cantera. En el informativo también se escucharán a los protagonistas de las noticias.

programme.title: La Liga 14/15
programme.desc: El fútbol español puede presumir de su Liga, una competición con una nómina de estrellas impresionante. El Atlético sueña con repetir título, aunque lo tendrá complicado ante los reforzados Barcelona y Real Madrid. El resto de equipos pelean por objetivos más mundanos.(c)

programme.title: Francotirador
programme.desc: Meses después de presenciar un asesinato, los últimos inquilinos de un bloque de pisos están siendo asesinados por un francotirador implacable que los ha encerrado en una trampa mortal. Aquellos que siguen vivos tratan de sobrevivir a cualquier precio. La pareja cinematográfica formada por James Nunn y Ronnie Thompson se estrenaron como directores de largometrajes con este intenso y angustioso thriller que obtuvo el premio a la mejor película eur.

Timecop - Patrulha do Tempo
programme.desc: Um oficial de uma agência de segurança que regula as viagens no tempo tem de lutar pela própria vida contra um político misterioso com uma ligação ao seu passado.

programme.title: Dead Trigger
programme.desc: Um misterioso vírus matou milhões de pessoas e transformou muitas outras em zombies sedentos de sangue… Incapaz de deter o vírus, o governo recruta jovens para formar um pelotão de elite: Dead Trigger.

programme.title: Básico
programme.desc: Tom Hardy, um ex-oficial do exército transformado em agente da DEA, investiga o desaparecimento do temível Sargento Nathan West, durante um exercício de rotina na selva do Panamá. À operação apenas sobreviveram dois membros da equipa, que contam versões divergentes do sucedido.

programme.title: Tal Pai, Tal Mãe 2
programme.desc: Dois anos depois da separação, o casal Vincent e Florence parece perfeitamente feliz e bem sucedido no divórcio, mas com a entrada de dois novos amantes nas suas vidas, tudo se vai complicar: são dois pais, duas mães e tudo duas vezes pior. Que comece o verdadeiro divórcio à francesa!

programme.title: Beatriz e Romeu
programme.desc: Romeu, um artista errante e sonhador, conhece a linda Beatriz e apaixona-se por ela, sem suspeitar que ela é filha do rei. Mas a felicidade dos dois vai ser interrompida quando o feiticeiro Chernomor rapta a rapariga obrigando o jovem a superar todos os perigos para a salvar.

programme.title: Todo o Dinheiro do Mundo
programme.desc: Quando o neto de 16 anos do homem mais rico do mundo, John Paul Getty, é raptado, a família recebe um pedido de resgate exorbitante, que o milionário se recusa a pagar. Com a vida do filho em jogo, Gail alia-se ao braço direito de Getty para tentar resolver a situação.

programme.title: Nanny McPhee - A Ama Mágica
programme.desc: A morte da mulher deixou Cedric Brown com a responsabilidade de criar sozinho os seus sete filhos. O caráter indomável das crianças faz com que as amas fujam, literalmente, de casa passado pouco tempo. Até que surge Nanny McPhee, uma ama com poderes especiais, capaz de pôr as crianças na ordem...

programme.title: A Profecia das Sombras
programme.desc: Depois da estranha morte da mulher, o jornalista John Klein dá por si numa pequena cidade de West Virginia, onde tenta investigar estranhos casos de visões psíquicas e a presença de um ser bizarro que lhe irá pôr a vida em perigo...

programme.title: As Crónicas de Riddick
programme.desc: Em fuga de mercenários decididos a arrecadar um prémio pela sua cabeça, Riddick vê-se no centro de uma batalha que não é sua. Com os conquistadores Necromongers a ameaçar o futuro de todo o Universo, ele poderá ser o único herói que consiga salvar a espécie humana.

programme.title: The Walk - O Desafio
programme.desc: Em 1974, o artista de trapézio Philippe Petit recruta uma equipa de pessoas para o ajudar a concretizar o seu sonho: atravessar na corda bamba a imensa distância entre as duas torres gémeas do World Trade Center.

programme.title: A Cidade
programme.desc: Douglas “Doug” MacRay é um assaltante que está a planear o próximo golpe mas que tem de lidar com os sentimentos que nutre por Claire, a gerente de um dos bancos que ele outrora assaltou, bem como o agente do FBI que o quer apanhar e à sua equipa.

programme.title: Danos Colaterais
programme.desc: Depois da sua família ser morta num ato terrorista, um bombeiro de Los Angeles parte para a Colômbia em busca dos responsáveis.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: 5/10. Barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass re-examine the case against a farm labourer hanged for the murder of a travelling watch repairman in 1880. [S,AD] [HD.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team travel across the country to talk to the new owners of three auction property buys. Will any of them manage to make a profit from the improvements they plan to make? [S,AD] [HD.

programme.title: Close Calls: on Camera
programme.desc: 10/20. Two young men are attempting to set a world record rowing the Atlantic when a freak wave capsizes their boat, and a family day out in the snow almost ends in tragedy. [S] [HD.

programme.title: Rocky Ros Muc
programme.desc: Documentary charting Sean Mannion's life and boxing career, examining his spirit inside the ring and his troubles outside from Ros Muc in Co Galway to Boston in America.

programme.title: Britain's Secret Treasures
programme.desc: Michael Buerk and Bettany Hughes present items 37 to 27 on the list of important historical artefacts unearthed by members of the public. Bettany goes diving for Roman treasure, Michael Portillo investigates a 2,000-year-old double-headed coin that could reveal the first political coalition, and John McCarthy tells the tale of a jewel-encrusted cross. There is also a jar full of gold coins found in Hackney that uncovers a link to the Nazis, and John Sergeant explores whether a hoard of French currency is genuine.

programme.title: The Six O'Clock Show

programme.title: Amazing Animal Births
programme.desc: Zoologist Lucy Cooke heads to an alpaca farm, where she helps with some complicated deliveries, and also meets a woman who has more than 300 guinea pigs, with the cameras capturing the newest arrivals being born.

programme.title: Live Racing
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of day four of the meeting, including the 3.15 King George Stakes, and supporting races at 2.15, 2.45 and 3.45. With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, social stable news with Oli Bell and commentary by Mark Johnson.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.sub-title: Gino's Italian Escape: A Taste of the Sun
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo sets off on another tour of his home country, this time exploring the north of Italy. In the first edition he examines the food that has shaped the city of Florence, beginning by tackling the bistecca alla Fiorentina - a thick and juicy steak - before preparing sliced T-bone with a colourful courgette ribbon and goat's cheese salad. He then heads to the town of Prato, sampling a pastry chef's speciality brioche buns with an aromatic, creamy filling, and conjuring up his own dessert of apple poached in red wine with amaretti biscuit cream.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Paul Treyvaud travels to Enniskillen, where he is given a masterclass in butchery and travels by boat to see the world famous black bacon pigs on their very own private island.

programme.title: News at 8
programme.desc: Colette Fitzpatrick presents the latest national and international headlines from the Virgin Media News Hub.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary fights for his life, and Adam senses Sarah is lying about her showdown with her ex. Meanwhile, Alya implores Elaine not to leave as she is the only hope of securing Yasmeen's freedom, and Ed sits down to a virtual anniversary dinner with Aggie via video call.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Barnaby is dragged along to the wedding of the son of Sarah's friend Hazel, the last thing he expects to find himself doing is investigating a murder. But when his wife discovers the body of the bride, Laurel, who has been squeezed to death by her own wedding dress corset, the detective must look more closely at his fellow guests. The victim's husband Gavin is convinced that his wife's death had everything to do with her outspoken nature on her radio show, so Winter's attention soon turns to her unique community of nocturnal listeners. Gavin's scorned ex-fiancee and local wedding dress designer Serena also comes under suspicion, and Barnaby and Winter's enquiries lead them to a local wedding fayre. Neil Dudgeon stars, with Kelly Brook, Nick Hancock and Liz Fraser.

programme.title: The Good Samaritan
programme.desc: Shane Richie stars as well-intentioned loser Brian Guest, who believes he's responsible for a man's death after he mistakes a suicidal phone call as a hoax, only to discover later it was a genuine cry for help. One-off comedy drama, with Louise Delamere and Brendan Coyle.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: Roy Urqhart's Escape from Arnhem: Major-General 'Roy' Urquhart led the doomed British attack on Arnhem, but somehow made it back across the Rhine, dodging enemy gunfire and patrols.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping The Rock
programme.desc: In 1962, three crooks vanished from the 'inescapable' Alcatraz island using a raft made of patched-up coats. Could they have survived the icy waters? Hear what the experts believe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: Shakespeares Legacy With John Nettles
programme.desc: April 2016 marked the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death. But what is the Bard's lasting legacy? Actor John Nettles reflects on the legendary playwright's life.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Fishmonger Float: Wartime hijinks. Renee's attempted assignations with Yvette in the broom cupboard seem more fraught with danger than any other resistance activity.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: A Fishy Send-Off: More laughs with famous babe magnet Rene and the gang. The Resistance disguise their latest dangerous operation behind a carnival float with a fishy theme.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: A Winkle in Time: The time has come to call 'Adieu, Adieu!' as Rene, his lovely wife Edith and all the regulars finally bow out at the close of the war.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The Nazis' concentration camps became centres for mass killings in World War II. Why did a system of concentrating populations lead to genocide? This final episode reveals all.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Compilation: Fiona Bruce introduces unscreened items from recent shows, including a garnet and diamond cross believed to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Lost Bridges: Hear about some magnificent bridges that time forgot. A hurricane put paid to Goat Canyon Trestle in California, while Kinzua Viaduct was destroyed by a tornado.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Durham to Grosmont: Michael Portillo takes to the tracks with George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook. A visit to the historic Durham Cathedral and a Dracula tour of Whitby.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: York to Saltaire: How did rail travel shape Britain? Michael Portillo takes a Turkish bath in Harrogate, explores the Victorian model village of Saltaire and encounters some alpacas.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Plas Newydd 1: The team visits the Plas Newydd country estate on Anglesey, where items brought in include a Victorian cane, an 18th century grandmother clock, and two giant toy giraffes.

programme.title: Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Life on Ice: Sir David Attenborough shares secrets of the natural world. Here he looks at the wood frog and the emperor penguin.

programme.title: Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Spinners and Weavers: The evergreen Sir David Attenborough weaves another tale of wonder as he salutes nature's most intricate structures, from spiders' webs to birds' nests.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railways
programme.desc: Railroad to Mandalay: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway, built by Second World War PoWs.

programme.title: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Rumours persist that a Nazi train laden with gold lies hidden in Poland. In 2015, two treasure hunters declared they had found it - but were their claims true.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Batley to Sheffield: More tales from a train. Michael Portillo hears about a Victorian recycling industry in Batley and meets a relative of the inspirational George Bradshaw himself.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Langley Mill to Melton Mowbray: Michael Portillo learns how trains shaped the controversial sport of fox hunting in another journey inspired by Victorian cartographer George Bradshaw.

programme.title: Wonders of the Solar System

programme.desc: North Of The Wall: A complex of stone buildings near Hadrian's Wall that were built to keep Northern hoards at bay! Also, a top secret military facility in the American Midwest.

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II
programme.desc: Mick "Crocodile" Dundee (Paul Hogan) is settling into his new Manhattan home when a South American drug dealer (Hechter Ubarry) abducts his girlfriend, Sue Charlton (Linda Kozlowski). The drug dealer thinks images of his criminal activities, taken by Sue's photographer ex-husband, are now in her hands. The dealer takes Sue to Colombia and threatens her, hoping that she'll give up the evidence. But intrepid Dundee, aiming to rescue Sue, is soon on the criminal's trail.

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Erin Brockovich (Julia Roberts) is a woman in a tight spot. Following a car accident in which Erin is not at fault, Erin pleads with her attorney Ed Masry (Albert Finney) to hire her at his law firm. Erin stumbles upon some medical records placed in real estate files. She convinces Ed to allow her to investigate, where she discovers a cover-up involving contaminated water in a local community which is causing devastating illnesses among its residents.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: As Alicia struggles to find her new role in the convoy, she's drawn to mysterious artwork; a simple scouting trip is derailed when she and Strand are thrust into a conflict between desperate survivors; Morgan and Al hit a roadblock.

programme.title: Botched
programme.sub-title: Boobs Dance and a Second Chance
programme.desc: While Dr. Nassif steps into the surgical ring to help a boxer's crushed nose, Dr. Dubrow needs his A game to bring a young woman's dead breasts back to life. And Norway's biggest breasts loves to make her boobs dance.

programme.title: The Soup
programme.desc: A new take on the long running series returns, setting comedic sights on the biggest OMG moments in pop culture. From reality TV, to social media, viral trends and streaming sensations, it's everything you can't miss this week. With Jade Catta-Preta.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House suspects that a patient's illness is genetic and needs a family history. But the man's only living relative, his father (John Larroquette), has been in a vegetative state for 10 years. Meanwhile, Wilson confronts House about stealing his prescription pad, and Tritter (David Morse) questions Cameron, Chase and Foreman in his effort to nail House on drug charges.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An 18-year-old (Patrick Fugit) who is the sole supporter of his brother and sister has a heart attack while working at a children's party restaurant, and House turns his diagnosis into a game for the staff. Meanwhile, Tritter has gotten the DEA to revoke Wilson's prescribing privileges, leaving House scrambling for a new Vicodin source as he develops a pain in his shoulder.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: No sooner does a 6-year-old in abdominal agony arrive at the hospital than her divorced parents begin sniping at each other. Meanwhile, Cuddy has restricted House's access to Vicodin, and his increased pain level makes him more difficult to deal with than usual. And Tritter (David Morse) interviews Foreman, Chase and Cameron individually, taking strikingly different approaches with each of them.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Wilson arranges a deal for House with Tritter (David Morse), and is criticized for it not only by House, who swears he'll never take it, but by Cuddy and Cameron as well. Meanwhile, Cuddy cuts an increasingly desperate House off Vicodin and takes him off the team's case: a 15-year-old little person who entered the hospital with a collapsed lung and anemia, and soon deteriorates.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A mobster about to enter the Witness Protection Program collapses before testifying. His coma doesn't last long, but there's something seriously wrong with his liver. Meanwhile, Vogler leans on Cuddy to fire House while House tries to find out who ratted him out to Vogler about his lie to the transplant committee. And in the clinic, House must deal with a 2-year-old who keeps getting things stuck up his nose. Vogler: Chi McBride. Bill: Danny Nucci. Joey: Joseph Lyle Taylor.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Vogler (Chi McBride) is forcing House to fire one member of his team. Which one? He lets them fight it out as they struggle to save an obese 10-year-old who had a heart attack. Meanwhile, a woman with a huge belly won't hear of it when House tells her she's pregnant.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Vogler (Chi McBride) is forcing House to fire one member of his team. Which one? He lets them fight it out as they struggle to save an obese 10-year-old who had a heart attack. Meanwhile, a woman with a huge belly won't hear of it when House tells her she's pregnant.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Vogler offers House a way out of his personnel problem. Meanwhile, a senator (Joe Morton) with presidential ambitions doesn't believe it when House tells him he has AIDS. And a clinic patient (Mindy Crider) doesn't believe it when House tells her she had a miscarriage. She says that she hasn't had sex in a year.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: It's payback time for Vogler (Chi McBride) after House's speech, leading to boardroom sessions that would make Donald Trump blanch. But House is focused on his patients: a pregnant 39-year-old who has trouble swallowing; and a low-weight baby whose parents have been feeding her a vegan diet. According to social-services authorities that constitutes child abuse.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: During a meningitis outbreak that fills the hospital, a 12-year-old diver exhibits many of the disease's symptoms, and some other ones, too. Meanwhile, with Vogler out of the picture, House offers Cameron her job back.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Cameron returns on one condition---that House goes on a date with her. In the clinic, meanwhile, House berates a young man (John Cho), who then has a stroke that will be the first of many. Also, House plays romantic referee to a seventysomething couple (June Squibb and Peter Graves).

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Sela Ward guest stars as House's former girlfriend, a one-time lawyer at the hospital, who wants House to figure out what's ailing her husband. Meanwhile, the dour doc is persuaded to teach a med-school diagnostics course, and his lecture is illustrated with fantasy sequences.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House's ex-girlfriend Stacy (Sela Ward) arranges for him to examine her husband, who's experiencing unexplained abdominal pain and mood swings. Other doctors say the cause is stress, but Stacy thinks otherwise. She also thinks that she and House might not be over each other.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A man (Howard Hesseman) suffers a seizure, then bacteria attack his heart, and he needs a transplant immediately. But the only potential donor was suffering from a mysterious illness that renders her heart unusable. At least that's what the protocols say. House isn't about to let that---or standard medical ethics---get in his way.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A man stops breathing during rough sex with his wife (Samantha Mathis), then he develops an agonizingly itchy rash, but those symptoms belie his test results. Meanwhile, House diagnoses a Wall Street workaholic with herpes. The man swears he had sex only with his wife, who swears (loudly to Cuddy) that she hasn't been cheating, either. And Wilson, who's soon to be single again, moves in with House. They make an odd couple indeed.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A 16-year-old girl (Michelle Trachtenberg) with a history of allergic reactions and a transplanted heart goes into shock at home, then suffers congestive heart failure at the hospital. “We've got two puzzle pieces from two different puzzles,” says a puzzled Foreman. Meanwhile, House proves to be a predictably difficult roommate for Wilson. Barbara: Mel Harris. Lewis: Lance Guest. Dan: Jake McDorman.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A 6-year-old's intestinal ailment leads to kidney and pituitary-gland failure. It's the same thing that happened to a 73-year-old woman who died---in one day---on House's watch 12 years earlier, and he's determined not to have it happen again. Cuddy has treated the boy before, but she doesn't know how sick he is because she's in the lobby downstairs, drinking heavily at a hospital-benefit poker tournament, and House isn't about to tell her.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A young woman (Jayma Mays) swallows a bottle of sleeping pills---not to kill herself but to go to sleep, something she says she hasn't done in 10 days. Then her case deteriorates, but her partner (Dahlia Salem) is in a perfect position to help her. Meanwhile, House keeps falling asleep because living with Wilson has disrupted his sleep pattern. And Cameron's mad at Foreman for swiping her ideas for a medical-journal article, and at House for letting him do it.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A 15-year-old faith healer (Thomas Dekker) collapses after laying his hands on an old woman in a walker. An MRI finds a brain abnormality, but he doesn't want it treated for fear that it might affect his healing capabilities. While in the hospital, the teen uses his power on a terminal patient (Tamara Braun) Wilson is treating. Elsewhere, Wilson moves out of House's apartment, but he still wants in on House's weekly poker games. Walter: William Katt.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Part 1 of two: An inner-city cop (Scott Michael Campbell) laughs as he corners a suspect, and even thinks it's funny when the suspect shoots him. But the gunshot wound isn't why he's in danger. Meanwhile, Foreman takes an immediate dislike to the officer. In fact, when his condition deteriorates, Foreman starts laughing. Then the doc gets sick as well.

programme.desc: The team search for a group of underground hackers led by Elvis Bertrand after thousands of classified-government files are stolen. Meanwhile, Sebastian joins the team as an NCIS Special Agent.
